Overview.text: Active internal re-warming for hypothermic patients

Indications.text:
Consider in:
Severe Hypothermia
Cardiovascular instability / life-threatening dysrhythmias
Moderate hypothermia which fails to respond to less aggressive measures

Procedure.text:
Catheter placement is similar to that used for
diagnostic peritoneal lavage
.
May consider two catheters, one for installation and one for drainage
[1]
Infuse 10 to 20 mL/kg of isotonic saline warmed to approximately 42Â°C
Leave fluid in the peritoneal cavity for 20 minutes, then remove
Overall exchange rate is 6 L/hour
